Sixteen pianists and five violinists, all students in public and private schools of the metropolitan area, have been selected for a series of seven weekly solo apearances over radio station WQXR starting April 1. The programs, entitled "Music Talent in Our Schools" will be part of the educational activities of THE NEW YORK TIMES.
PEARL RIVER, N.Y., March 7 Frank Perkins Jr., the crow shooter of Rockland County, was arrested today and the police chief of the local township was disturbed mightily by the...

The price of tin in the world's three leading, markets Singapore, London and New York collapsed yesterday in the wake of the decision in Washington to stop stockpiling tin until the price reaches a "reasonable level."

In the early Sixties Dr. James Knight, who served as medical director for the Association for Improving the Condition of the Poor when he was not practicing medicine in his private office, was convinced that his colleagues were wrong in regarding the crippled as...

ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 7 One of the main reasons Leo Durocher converted Clint Hartung into an outfielder this spring was the fact that at least once a day the Hondo Hurricane will smack a ball for a country mile or more.

Stimulating and exciting, Adrian's spring and summer collection, viewed yesterday at Gunther Jaeckel, surprassed all his previous successes. In addition to color, fluid movement and vibrant imagination, the clothes produced a feeling that all the great talents of this designer had ripened into full maturity.

WASHINGTON, March 7 Consumption of steel in the production of about 150 items of consumer durable goods was cut back by 20 per cent for the second quarter of this year by the National Production Authority. The order affects manufacturers of passenger cars, radios, lawn mowers and scores of other items.

The stock market turned around yesterday and retraced the ground lost in the previous session although gains were selective and generally of major fractions. The news on the domestic economic front continued highly confusing and again confounded market followers but the relaxation of some controls brought a measure of comfort to certain industries.

Individual paper casseroles, in which foods may be heated and served, and an ingenious device for storing, slicing and serving butter are two kitchen accessories just beginning to appear in stores here.

Home furnishings stores here that derive most of their volume from credit sales will cut dollar buying commitments 7 to 10 per cent and more in the second quarter, compared with the like 1950 period. This was disclosed yesterday by several merchants who said bedroom and dining room furniture manufacturers will suffer most from the decrease in orders.
WASHINGTON, March 7 (AP) Announced United States casualties in the Korean war reached 52,448 today, an increase of 1,773 in a week.
The New York Rangers, who have been fattening up all season at the expense of the Chicago Black Hawks (as who in the National Hockey League hasn't?) handed their Windy City "cousins"...

United Nations forces resumed offensive operations Wednesday as Eighth Army tank-infantry teams, supported by devastating artillery fire, breached the Han River defenses near the junction of the Han and Pukhan Rivers east of Seoul, registering gains of from two to three miles.
WASHINGTON, March 7 (UP) The House Committee on UnAmerican Activities released today a list of 624 organizations and 204 publications that had been declared subversive by some Government agency.

WASHINGTON, March 7 Rejection of proposals for a Federal sales tax was predicted today by Representative Robert L. Doughton, Democrat of North Carolina, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee.
American investors will be offered today $50,000,000 of twentyyear 2 7/8 per cent debentures of the Province of Quebec. They are priced at 97 , to yield about 3.025 per cent.

FRANKFORT, Germany, March 7 Voices from the left and the right demanded abolition of remaining Allied controls today as the Western powers and the Federal Government tackled the twin tasks of speeding Germany's integration into the Western community and negotiating a new basis for their relationship in this country.

WASHINGTON, March 7 The Senate Crime Investigating Committee voted today to cite James J. Carroll, nationally known betting commissioner, for contempt of Congress to test whether a witness can be forced to testify before television cameras.

Several bushel baskets and boxes full of letters and other manuscripts, brought in from New Jersey yesterday for appraisal by an expert at the National Antiques Show at Madison Square Garden, yielded new material for historians of the Lincoln family.

MOSCOW, March 7 The Soviet state budget for 1951 was presented tonight to the Supreme Soviet in the presence of Generalissimo Stalin and the entire Politburo. It was revealed to provide 96,376,000,000 rubles for the Armed Forces or 21.3 per cent of the total budget expenditures of 451,503,000,000 rubles.
New York City's sales tax began as a 1 per cent "temporary" levy enacted in 1934 to put emergency relief of the depression days on a pay-as-we-go basis. Like other temporary taxes, it came to stay.

CLEARWATER, Fla., March 7 Tradition ordains that the championship winner of the year before automatically is chosen as the favorite for the season to come. That necessarily would make the Philadelphia Whiz Kids a hot choice in the winter book if you will pardon the use of a gambling term on the sports page, instead of the front page, where most gambling is discussed these days.
WASHINGTON, March 7 An additional 12,650 lieutenants and captains from the Organized Reserve Corps and the National Guard will be ordered into active duty by June 29, the Army announced today.

WASHINGTON, March 7 (UP)--Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson said today that members of Congress of both parties had been abusing their free-mail privileges in election campaigns for as long as he could remember.

In its 149th year of operations, E.I. du Pont de Nemours Co., Inc., one of America's leading industrial concerns and the giant of the chemical field, surpassed all previous production, sales and earnings records last year. It becomes the third biggest money-maker to report on 1950 operations, surpassed only by General Motors Corporation and American Telephone Telegraph Company.
SANTIAGO, Chile, March 7 (UP) The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development has agreed in principle to lend Chile $22,000,000 for further industrial expansion.

ALBANY, March 7 Oswald D. Heck, Speaker of the Assembly, indicated in an interview today that Republican legislative leaders had dropped their plan to undertake a Seabury-type investigation of New York City, particularly as to reputed tie-ups between crime and politics.

LONDON, March 7 The stock markets here were disturbed today by news of the slaying of the Premier of Iran. There was some recovery when it was learned that the murder was an act of a religious fanatic.

In the Government's anti-trust suit against certain investment banking houses yesterday a discussion took place of a 1937 memorandum of the reorganized banking firm of Kidder, Peabody Co., which remarked on the "right of divine inheritance" claimed a quarter of a century ago by the...

A stubborn fire, obscured by dense billows of white smoke, resisted the efforts of 200 firemen and thirty-four pieces of firefighting equipment for seven hours yesterday morning in the loft quarters of a paper products company at 628 Broadway, between Houston and Bleecker Streets.

MINEOLA, L.I. March 7 Gov. Dewey's proposed plan for the establishment of a Long Island Rail Road Redevelopment Corporation was accepted here today by Nassau County officials as a "plan which merits trial."

PRINCETON, N.J., March 7 The blue-clad athletes from Columbia completed a brilliant chapter in basketball history tonight, when they became the first team from their college to sweep through a season undefeated.
Essential work on building and repairing fighting ships is being held up at the New York Naval Shipyard in Brooklyn for lack of sheet metal mechanics.

SANTA FE, N.M., March 7 (AP) The New Mexico School Board yesterday banned the wearing of religious garb by teachers in public schools. It also decided not to rent school buildings from religious groups except under "exceptional circumstances."
Federal Reserve member banks in this district had net profits of $201,000,000 in 1950, the highest level since 1946, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York disclosed yesterday.

WITH THE TWENTY-FIFTH DIVISION, in Korea, March 7 Infantrymen of this crack United States division, veterans first of the Pacific and now of this Korean war, plunged through rice paddies and into snow-powdered hills today in one of their most savage onslaughts as they forced their way across the Han River above Seoul and thrust into Communist territory fifteen miles upstream from the old Korean capital.

CAIRO, March 7 (UP)--Dick Savitt of Orange, N.J., and Miss Louise Brough of Beverly Hills, Calif., scored easy victories today in the Egyptian tennis championships, but Sven Davidsson of Sweden pulled the tournament's biggest surprise by defeating Budge Patty, Wimbledon champion, 6--1, 12--10, 6--2, in the men's singles quarter-finals.

ALBANY, March 7--Governor Dewey proposed today that the state actively promote a reorganization of the bankrupt Long Island Rail Road and grant certain tax and other concessions so it can continue under private ownership and operation.

HALLANDALE, Fla., March 7 (AP) Blue Speed, who has a knack of winning for different owners, made it three in a row for the Florida season as he sped to victory in the featured seventh race, a test for 3-year-olds that drew a field of twelve at Gulfstream Park today.

VERO BEACH, Fla., March 7 The posting of the Dodgers' line-up for Saturday night's opening exhibition game at Miami Stadium against the Braves brought lifted eyebrows today because of the lead-off man.

ALBANY, March 7 The Joint Legislative Committee on Election Law Revision split sharply down the middle today over the issue of permanent personal registration, as legislative action on the proposal was delayed by shunting it to a new committee.
WASHINGTON, March 7 A verdict of guilty on four counts, two of which carry a mandatory death penalty, was returned by a Federal jury this afternoon against Oscar Collazo, Puerto Rican...

No matter how thoroughly the value is demonstrated of nursery school experience for children 3 to five, widespread support for public nursery education is not likely to be won until the needs of the country's elementary and secondary schools have been met, Earl James MeGrath, United States Commissioner of Education, said last night.

LEGISLATION to prevent the construction of water supply dams on the Beaverkill and Willowemoc, two of the most popular trout streams in the East, will soon come before the Senate and Assembly in Albany. It is in the Committee on Internal Affairs.

MONTCLAIR, N.J., March 7 Miss Eleanor Vreeland Doremus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Speer Doremus, will be married April 14 to James Lewis Courter Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Courter of Roseland, formerly of Verona.

A group of four two-story garden apartment buildings accommodating eighty-eight families in Flushing, Queens, has been sold by Earl Gallant to an investing customer of. Paul P. Zinner, Inc., broker in the transaction.
Despite a reported "creeping paralysis" in the leather industry because of Government delay in issuing a price order for hides, manufacturers pranced some orders at the leather, trade show yesterday.
CHICAGO, March 7 Grains advanced sharply on the Board of Trade today as a result of a broad buying movement which found offerings light. Wheat paced the upturn, closing 3 to 3 7/8 cents higher.

HELSINKI, March 7 The score of Soviet diplomats stationed at Helsinki have suddenly turned on the charm and have become very sociable. The Finns see in this phenomenon a promise of at least a let-up in the constant nerve war that Moscow carries on against this country by means of the press and radio.

ALBANY, March 7 Chances for passage of the constitutional amendment designed to allow the Legislature to supplement the pensions of retired public employes virtually disappeared today as State Controller J. Raymond McGovern set forth reasons why he regarded the measure as unwise.

PHOENIX, Ariz., March 8 Joe Page was practicing for the beginning and looking forward to the end today as the Yankees pursued their supercharged training routine with an over-all workout in the morning and a scrub game in the afternoon.
ALBANY, March 8-The Dewey, Administration's weight-distance truck tax-received swift approval in both Senate and Assembly today. The vote in the Senate was 51 to 3 and in the Assembly 90 to 47.

HOLLYWOOD, Calif., March 8 "Days Before Lent," a 1939 novel by Hamilton Basso which MetroGoldwyn-Mayer bought for the screen at the time of publication and subsequently shelved, has been revived by the studio and assigned to John Houseman for production.

Robert L. Doughton, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, predicts that proposals for a federal sales tax will be rejected. Mr. Doughton may be correct in his prophecy, but for a person of his long experience in the field of tax legislation the reasoning with which he supports...
Dayton, Ohio, sold yesterday $5,000,000 of waterworks bonds due April 1, 1953 to 1982 to Harris Trust and Savings Bank and associates at a bid of 102.59 for interest at 2 per cent.

LONDON, March 8 A demand for an immediate general election "to end the present Parliamentary farce" in Britain was made today by the National Union of Conservative and Unionists Associations, the central body of the Conservative party.

In reading General MacArthur's most recent appraisal of the situation and the prospects in Korea one should keep in mind that this is the report of a military commander. In that role General MacArthur has had considerable experience.
WASHINGTON, March 8 Virgil Munday Chapman, senior Senator from Kentucky, died of injuries today a few hours after an automobile collision. He was 55 years old.

St. John's, seeded first in the National Invitation college basketball tournament, yesterday was selected for the Eastern Regionals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association competition, which will start on March 20, it was announced by Asa S. Bushnell, chairman of the Eastern selection committee.
The executive board of Local 802, American Federation of Musicians, voted yesterday to calls a strike Wednesday at 6 P.M. against the New York television and radio stations of the major networks.

Tin prices both in the spot and futures markets skidded further yesterday in response to the Government's decision to suspend stockpiling of the strategic metal until prices reached a more reasonable level. Quotations also were sharply lower in the primary markets at Singapore and London.
Civil war has broken out among the top leaders of the Textile Workers Union of America, C.I.O., now engaged in one strike and on the verge of another.

Office employes at the Columbia Broadcasting System must vote again to determine what union, if any, they wish to represent them in collective bargaining with management. Wednesday's election, conducted by the National Labor Relations Board, resulted in no union receiving a majority of votes.

A consolidated net profit of $88,161,270 was made last year by the Kennecott Copper Corporation, the nation's largest producer of copper and a leader in the world copper trade. This was 83 per cent greater than the 1949 net of $48,110,273, and would have exceeded the 1948 record earnings of $93,806,919 but for increased taxes.
The power of the Jockey Club to license owners, trainers and jockeys of race horses was wiped out yesterday by a unanimous decision of the New York State Court of Appeals.

WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) A Government-agency report to Congress on interlocking relationships among directors of big manufacturing concerns cites companies in the iron and steel industry as among "outstanding" examples.
A public hearing on an application by the Grace Line for an operating subsidy for its New York-Caribbean service was ordered yesterday by the Federal Maritime Board. The date has not yet been set.

WASHINGTON, March 8 (UP) The House Un-American Activities Committee has compiled a list of "secret contributors" to the Communist party in Hollywood that contains many names well known in the movie industry, it was disclosed today.

SANTIAGO, Chile, March 8 The Chilean Government has presented a three-point proposal to the United States whereby it would encourage a considerable increase in the production of copper. In return it seeks an increase in price and permission to sell part of the greater output to other countries possessing commodities that Chile needs.

NEW DELHI, March 8 (AP) Iran, the little country of the big weight-lifters, regained the unofficial lead in the Asian Games again today, after yielding the top spot for a time to the powerful team from Japan.

The Long Island Rail Road is not mentioned by name in the legislation of which Governor Dewey has announced his sponsorship, but no other transportation system in the state or indeed in the world meets the description in the bills.
The General Telephone Corporation, second largest telephone system in the world, had a record net income of $4,135,727 last year, a 36 per cent gain over the $3,039,977 in 1949.

ROME, March 8 Six survivors of a four-engine United States Navy Privateer plane that had crashed into the sea between Ostia, and Nettuno yesterday afternoon were rescued shortly after noon today by the Italian destroyer Carabinieri.

Camellias, roses and carnations dominated the thirty-three classes added to the International Flower Show at Grand Central Palace yesterday. The number of entries for the week passed 470, with some gardeners placing flowers in as many as seven classes a day, others in only one for the entire show.
TOKYO, Friday, March 9 United Nations forces rolled ahead yesterday in the second day of their renewed offensive in Korea with advances of up to five miles in some sectors.

LONDON, March 8--The Labor Government sought and won today a respite from further opposition attacks against it for its share in the "affair of the admirals"--the appointment of an American instead of a British supreme commander in the Atlantic. This twelve-power Atlantic treaty appointment has caused widespread indignation in this country.
NEW DELHI, India, March 8 A simple promise by the Mao Tsetung Government to the Dalai Lama of internal autonomy in Tibet while the Chinese Communists take over the frontier patrol...

The twenty-seventh annual convention of the Columbia Scholastic Press Association opened yesterday as 3,200 student journalists assembled on the university campus for three days of panel discussions designed to aid school publications throughout the country.

Increased crude oil production, a general hardening in prices in the last six months and increased efficiency enabled the Shell Oil Company to attain a new high record in its 1950 sales and the second largest profit in its twenty-nineyear history. Before taxes, earnings exceeded the peak established in 1948.

How man progressed from eating with his fingers to eating with forks is only one of the subjects explored by an exhibition opening today at the Museum of Natural History and continuing through April 1.

Two five-story apartment houses containing a total of 108 apartments at 690-692 and 700-702 East 139th Street, the Bronx, have bean purchased by the Nordley Realty Corporation from Hillary Properties. Pearce, Mayer Greer were the brokers. The attorneys were Gettinger Gettinger for the seller and Bernard Friedman for the buyer.

Registering the inescapable conclusions of the great debate on the role which the United States must play in defense of the free world, the Senate Foreign Relations and Armed Services Committees have unanimously approved and sent to the Senate floor a resolution providing for the dispatch...

WASHINGTON, March 8 New wage regulations were issued today putting limits on the rates paid in new plants and extending the pay rises allowed in earlier orders to additional, related groups of employes.

HARTFORD, Conn., March 8 A report on the economic feasibility of the proposed $250,000,000 steel mill in the New London area, prepared by the New York engineering firm of Coverdale and Colpitts, was recalled suddenly today by the authors after it already had been distributed to some newspaper men.

ALBANY, March 8 (AP) Stripping the Board of Regents of many administrative duties and drastic realignment of the board's membership structure was recommended tonight by the state's "Little Hoover Commission."
Another thrilling chapter in the city's baffling Case of the Vanishing Wire Trash Baskets was unearthed yesterday from the Department of Sanitation's "Whodunit" files.

The Moss Realty Corporation, represented by Jacob B. Menkes, has purchased for investment from a client of Arnstein Schwartz, attorneys, the six-story apartment house for eighty-nine families on plot 200 by 100 feet at 9 to 23 Thayer Street, between Nagle and...

Fifty mothers of Minna Street a thoroughfare that stretches three blocks in the westerly end of the Flatbush section of Brooklyn decided yesterday to resolve what they termed were "hazardous" traffic conditions.

Wiretap records made by Kings County District Attorney's investigators from Harry Gross' Long Island wireroom were introduced yesterday as evidence by the prosecution in support of its perjury charge against Aaron Feld, a retired policeman.

To any amateur gardener a visit to the flower show can be a somewhat unnerving experience. there is so professional,so tidy and neat, so removed from such manifestations of nature as crab grass and the Japanese beetle.

The proposed construction of two marginal playgrounds and a public comfort station in Joyce Kilmer Park on the Grand Concourse between 162d and 164th Streets, the Bronx, was abandoned yesterday as a result of protests by residents of the area.
Plans for construction of a third tube of the Lincoln Tunnel to cost $85,000,000 were approved yesterday by the commissioners of the Port of New York Authority.

ALBANY, March 8 (AP)-A bill to guarantee "needy" state and local employes on pension at least $75 a month until July 1, 1952, was introduced in the Assembly today with the Dewey Administra,tion's backing.
WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) Two Cabinet members declared tonight against any form of compulsory censorship for American newspapers in the present emergency.
There has been "a marked increase" in the number of influenza cases reported in the last two weeks, Dr. John F. Mahoney, Health Commissioner, announced yesterday.

Two new safety devices, to be used until the Long Island Rail Road can install its automatic speed-control equipment a year or eighteen months from now, were proposed yesterday by the road to the Public Service Commission.
Across the Korean front Thursday United Nations forces continued the attack and advanced generally from one to three miles in the Han River bridgehead area. Commanding ground was secured.

AMSTERDAM, March 8 Usually well-informed Dutch circles declared today that the ban of the United States on new tin purchases for stockpiling could refer only to quantities to be purchased in the open market. They, therefore, assumed it did not refer...

Out of a hint and a grimace F. Hugh Herbert has spun a droll romantic comedy, "The Moon Is Blue," which opened at the Henry Miller last evening and ought to stay open for quite a long time. It includes four characters, one of whom works for only about three minutes before he is through for the day; and the plot is about as extensive as a brief anecdote.

A three-year struggle over alleged discrimination issues entered a decisive phase yesterday when the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company opened its case to evict thirty-one tenants of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village in the Fourth District of Municipal Court.

PARIS, March 8 The charge that emissaries of the United States have dangerously encouraged Arab nationalism in North Africa against the interests of France and of Europe was made in an article published in Le Monde today, under the signature of Edouard Sablier, described as a specialist on the Arab world.

Provisions for industrial techniques required in shifting over business contracts from data based on the old consumers price index to the new interim index of the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor will involve a minimum of difficulties, management executives said here yesterday.

WHEREAS the foreign policy and military strength of the United States are dedicated to the protection of our national security, the preservation of the liberties of the American people, and the maintenance of world peace; and...

MIAMI BEACH, Fla., March 8 (AP)--Al Brosch, a lanky 39-year-old pro from Garden City, L. I., fired a 66 over the Normandy Isle golf course today to set the first-round pace in the $10,000 Miami Beach open tournament.

In a contest that offers each a chance to advance to the forefront as a title contender, Rex Layne, promising young Utah heavyweight, will meet hardhitting Bob Satterfield of Chicago over the ten-round route at Madison Square Garden tonight.

TEHERAN, Iran, March 8--A Parliamentary committee voted unanimously for nationalization of the oil industry tonight, a few hours after the funeral of Premier Gen. Ali Razmara, who was assassinated yesterday because he had opposed the plan.

The significant change now taking place in the structure of the market for Government securities does not seem to be fazing underwriting syndicates in their marketing operations. New issues of all kinds common and preferred stock and high-grade bonds are being taken into commitment as scheduled, and from all reports are making out all right among investors.
ALBANY, March 8 'The Assembly Codes Committee killed by unanimous vote today the BraistedReidy bill, which provided a mandatory jail sentence of ninety days for bookmakers convicted a third time.

The Industrial Union of Marine and Shipbuilding Workers of America, C.I.O. is meeting some difficulties in its efforts to bring a11 East Coast shipyards up to the wage standards set in a settlement covering the 18,000 workers in the Bethlehem Steel Company's eight Atlantic Coast shipyards.

The Board of Education was caught unaware in recent months by the problem of narcotics addiction among school children, but steps have been taken to deal with the situation, Dr. Frank J. O'Brien, associate superintendent in charge of child welfare, said yesterday.

ALBANY, March 8--Amendments to the bill to create a civil defense council and setting forth its powers have failed to remove the basic objections of the City of New York to the bill, Corporation Counsel John P. McGrath declared at a public hearing today in the Senate chamber.

ANKARA, Turkey, March 8 (UP) American construction workers are speeding completion of a protective ring of Turkish airfields that would put atom bomb carrying planes within about three hours flying time of Moscow.

Tomorrow night marks the twenty-third and final performance of "The High Ground" at the Forty-eighth Street. In retrospect it should be noted that the producer, Albert H. Rosen, didn't stint in any department. His affection for the offering was amply manifested when he got Margaret Webster, Tom Helmore and Leueen MacGrath to star in Charlotte Hastings' melodrama, a London

Linen, silk surah and springweight tweeds all add up to Easter parade fashions at Ohrbach's. This store believes that for an early Easter, an unlined tweed jacket and skirt combined with a linen blouse will be perfect under a fur or a topcoat.
ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., March 8 If the Giants fail to get off to a snappy start when the barrier lifts on the National League flag race this year, it certainly won't be for lack of conditioning.

"Tyrant From Illinois: Uncle Joe Cannon's Experiment With Personal Power," by Blair Bolles, will be published on March 19 by Norton. Mr. Bolles, director of the Washington bureau of the Foreign Policy Association, presents a study of Cannon's actions from 1908 to 1910, when as Speaker of the House he controlled Congress, and of his relations with Presidents Roosevelt and Taft and Senator Robert M. La Follette.

TODAY at 3:30 P.M. a performance of native and classic dances of Hungary will be given by Paul Szilard Co., at the American Museum of Natural History, Central Park West at Seventy-ninth Street. Tickets range from 60 to 90 cents.
WASHINGTON, March 8 On a 5-to-4 vote strictly following party lines, the House Rules Committee cleared to the floor today the Administration's defense housing bill.
Four teen-age boys were arrested last night in connection with the accidental shooting last Monday night of two small boys near the Madison Square Boys Club, 301 East Twenty-ninth Street.
The first group of 19-year-olds in the city probably will be called into military service by the end of April or in May, Col. Candler Cobb, City Director of Selective Service, reported yesterday.
CHATSWORTH, N. J., March 8--Some residents in the area of this South Jersey community have come to the gloomy conclusion that some people just will not answer questions.

Mayor Impellitterl announced yesterday that he would appoint Henry L. McCarthy as Welfare Commissioner to succeed Commissioner Raymond M. Hilliard, whose resignation becomes effective April 30. Mr. McCarthy has served for the past fourteen months as Mr. Hilliard's administrative assistant.

ALBANY, March 8 The Senate approved today by a vote of 41 to 11 a change in the state's libel law to offset the possible effect of a recent decision by the Court of Appeals in a case involving a report of a judicial proceeding by The New York Daily News.

Salvatore T. Sollazzo was indicted yesterday on thirteen bribery counts arising out of the successful "fixing" of games through four City College basketball stars and a frustrated attempt on a New York University player.
Max Elitcher, a soft-spoken Government witness who was an electrical engineer in the Navy's Bureau of Ordnance during the war, described in Federal Court...

Net income last year of the Phelps Dodge Corporation, second largest domestic copper producer of the country, was up 22 per cent to $42,395,465 from $34,715,185 in 1949, reflecting a higher average copper price and somewhat better sales and production.

Technical difficulties in applying the maintenance, repair and operating supplies priority order issued last week by the National Production Authority have prevented many of the nation's largest purchasing departments from starting to use these ratings. Their application has been delayed despite demands by many manufacturers that such ratings be issued on all...
Business loans dropped $64,000,000 last week. The decline, however, largely reflected the use of proceeds of new security issues by public utility companies.
YONKERS, March 8--The proposed route through this populous city for a four-mile link of the $450,000,000 New York-Buffalo Thruway was announced today by the State Thruway Authority.
WASHINGTON, March 8 Modifications in the Controlled Materials Plan, which the National Production Authority expects to put into effect on July 1 to control distribution of steel, copper
TRENTON, March 8 The legislative appropriations committee announced today it would propose to the Legislature an administration budget for the 1951-52 fiscal year of $180,171,614.

Net premiums written by the Federal Insurance Company and its subsidiary, the Vigilant Insurance Comapany, increased to $20,291, 587 in 1950 from $17,304,242 in 1949, Percy Chubb 2d, president, has reported.

William Hong bought for investment from 81 Chrystie Street, Inc., the six-story apartment house on plot 50 by 100 feet at 81-83 Chrystie Street in a deal negotiated by Henry A. Strauss, broker. Title Guarantee and Trust Company insured title to the property, which is assessed at $22,500.

ALBANY, March 8 Governor Dewey said today he "cordially disliked" the idea of increasing New York City's sales tax from 2 to 3 per cent but he left the door open to approval "with reluctance" of a pending bill to permit such an increase.

OSSINING, N.Y., March 8 Raymond Fernandez, 35 years old, and Mrs. Martha Beck, 30, termed by the police the "Lonely Hearts slayers," went to the electric chair in Sing Sing prison tonight to pay the penalty for murder.
Bartlett Harding Hayes, owner or a date palm plantation at Indio, Calif., and a former Boston stockbroker, died yesterday at Tucson, Ariz., where he was visiting. His age was 75.

TRENTON, March 8 Opposition to the death penalty or a belief in the guilt of some or all the defendants caused the elimination again today of many prospective jurors in the murder retrial of six men accused of killing a 72-yearold shopkeeper during a hold-up here three years ago.

LOS ANGELES, March 8 "Ways of Love," the European film trilogy which includes Roberto Rossellini's "The Miracle," banned in New York as sacrilegious after Roman Catholic denunciations, opened here last night at the 600seat Monica Theatre to a full house without overt opposition from the church

Laddie Northridge has a magical way of creating pretty hats. Spic., and span in their simplicity or twined with romantic flowers, they presented a tempting array in his Easter and summer collection yesterday at the Plaza Hotel.

ALBANY, March 8--The State Rent Commission recommended to the Legislature today that the provisions of the McGoldrick rent plan, which permits rent increases up to 15 per cent, be "affirmed" by direct legislative approval.
FAIRFIELD, Conn., March 8 Miss Joanne Reycroft, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wendell G. Reycroft, has selected March 31 for her marriage to Phillip Ives Crawford, son of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Crawford.

RANGOON, Burma, March 8 (AP) Burmese Premier Thakin Nu today described talk of a menace to Burma from Communist China as a myth created by persons wishing to disrupt relations between the two countries.

KEY WEST, Fla., March 8--Almost everyone does it sooner or later--that is, jump into the water with his wrist watch on. President Truman plunged into the Atlantic, and it was some time before he noticed the golden gleam on his wrist. That was yesterday.

WASHINGTON, March 8 Representative Carl Vinson, Democrat of Georgia and chairman of the House Armed Services Committee, said today his committee would follow the example of the Senate by writing a ceiling of 4,000,000 on the strength of the armed forces into the military manpower bill the House group now has under consideration.
TRENTON, March 8 Charles D. Anderson, an assistant staff commissioner of education, died yesterday at St. Francis Hospital, where he had been admitted two weeks ago for treatment for meningitis.

WASHINGTON, March 8 Walter L. Dunham, a Republican director of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, swore to a Senate investigating subcommittee today that C. Edward Rowe, the agency's vice chairman, had tried to induce him to resign suddenly and be "the goat" for board actions that have led to Congressional investigation.
WASHINGTON, March 8 (AP) Tobacco producers, manufacturers and retailers protested to Congress today against proposed stiff increases in the tax on cigarettes and cigars.

The General Electric Company, largest manufacturer of electrical equipment in the world, took its place alongside other record-profit industries last year with a net income of $173,424,000. That was a gain of 38 per cent over the previous peak of $125,639,000 in 1949.

Closed almost six weeks because of confusion over the Government's price-control program, trading in cotton futures was resumed yesterday on the New York Cotton Exchange. Despite a tremendous volume of orders, trading was orderly and final prices were 86 to 170 points, or $4.30 to $8.50 a bale, higher than at the previous closing on Friday, Jan. 26.

GROSSE POINT, Mich., March 8--Dr. and Mrs. Silas Willard Wallace have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elaine, to Lieut. Charles Wedgwood Turner, U. S. N., of Washington, a grandson of Mrs. Charles Warren Turner of Malvern, Ark.

Details of how hospitals, first aid stations and other medical emergency units will meet an enemy attack were made public yesterday by Dr. Marcus D. Kogel, Commissioner of Hospitals and director of the Medical Emergency Division in the city's civil defense program.

AFTER Pitkin Taylor was murdered in the Sutton-Taylor feud his funeral was held on a knoll beside a small stream. A Taylor sympathizer described what happened: "Across the river while the funeral services were being conducted Bill Sutton assembled his cutthroat gang in bold mockery. With raw drink and coarse jest and wild firing of guns they cele-...
Gross operating revenues of the Port of New York Authority were $42,198,237 in 1950, a rise of 12.4 p cent over 1949 when revenues were $37,524,910, the annual report said yesterday.
ARCADIA, Calif., March 8 (AP) Jockey Gordon Glisson, American riding champion in 1949,suf fered a fractured back today in a heavy spill at Santa Anita Park during the running of the fourth race.
ST. LOUIS, March 8 (AP) The Missoui Pacific Railroad Company, in bankruptcy for eighteen years, said today it was now solvent.

The stock market had a difficult time yesterday in keeping its balance and, despite the slowest trading in six months, managed to close irregularly higher on the New York Stock Exchange. The day's grist of news on the economic front again offered no clue for activity.

WASHINGTON, March 8--Medical requirements of the armed services are being hampered and civilian health standards lowered by highway accident victims, who pre-empt more than 2,700,000 hospital-days a year, according to data presented today at the annual meeting of the National Committee for Traffic Safety here.

WASHINGTON, March 8 The listed sponsors of "From the Record," a hard-hitting political tabloid used against former Senator Millard E. Tydings, Democrat unseated in Maryland last fall, disowned responsibility today for the material it contained or its distribution.

PARIS, March 8 Dr. Philip C. Jessup, United States Ambassador at Large, warned Andrei A. Gromyko, Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister, this afternoon that the majority of the people in the free world and those seeking to escape...
CAMBRIDGE, Mass., March 8--Harvard University plans the construction of two new buildings, a laboratory and a lecture hall within a few months.

The question of how to meet increasing demands for day care for children without lowering the quality of such services, was asked again and again yesterday at special meetings and forum discussions on the first full day of the National Association for Nursery Education's biennial conference here.

SANTIAGO, Chile, March 8 Senator Eduardo Cruz Coke, Chilean representative in the United Nations Economic and Social Council, suggested today that par of the $800,000,000 that Latin-American countries had on deposit in the United States banks might be used...

BUENOS AIRES, March 8 (AP) Don Barksdale led an inspired United States team that beat off a last-half surge by Argentina to win the Pan-American basketball championship, 57-51, before 25,000 hostile fans tonight.

FORT WAYNE, Ind., March 8 Former United States Senator Samuel Dillon Jackson, whose gavel helped obtain the Vice Presidential nomination for Harry Truman, died today in St. Joseph Hospital at the age of 56.

PHILADELPHIA, March 8 Alastair B. Martin, the defender from Glen Head, L.I., Robert L. Gerry of New York, Charles Devens of Boston and William E. Lingelbach of this city reached the semi-final round of the national amateur court tennis championship at the racquet club today.
ALBANY, March 8 Administration bills embodying Governor Dewey's suggestions to permit continued private operation of the Long Island Rail Road through tax and other concessions

WITH TWENTY-FIFTH DIVISION, in Korea, March 8 The crossing of the Han River today wrote a new chapter in the experiment to bring air and army ground forces into closer liaison in Korea. This afternoon, a day after this division crossed the river, pilots of the Fifth Air Force were with the troops, studying methods of tying in artillery and infantry more completely with air strikes.
The Advertising Council, which represents the entire field of advertising, is planning a widespread campaign to tell the average citizen of his duties in the event of an atomic attack.
TAMPA, Fla., March 8 (AP) Nine men came up and nine went down in order today as Ewell Blackwell, strong right-hander of the Reds' pitching staff, made his first competitive start of spring training.

The concert by the Philharmonic-Symphony Orchestra last night in Carnegie Hall, with Dimitri Mitropoulos conducting and Jascha Heifetz in an incomparable performance of the Sibelius violin concerto, was a historic occasion.

LAKE SUCCESS, March 8 The Government of El Salvador has signed a basic agreement with the United Nations and five specialized agencies for the establishment of the world's first area to demonstrate the progress that can be made in health and welfare through a comprehensive technical assistance program.

DETROIT, March 8 Ezzard Charles today viewed the boxing situation through wondering eyes. The heavyweight champion of the world is eager to risk the crown that he defended against Jersey Joe Walcott last night, and risk it in an outdoor fight, but the problem is: whom will he fight?

WASHINGTON, March 8 The Truman Administration's decision to station American ground troops in Europe for the common defense of the West was endorsed, 23 to 0, today by the combined Senate Foreign Relations and Armed Services committees.

MIAMI, Fla., March 8-Traveling in the Brooklyn club plane, which made three round trips, and in automobiles, the Dodgers came here today for continuation of training and the playing of eighteen exhibition games mostly at night.
JOHANNESBURG, March 8 (AP) An immediate increase in diamond prices was announced today by the Diamond Trading Company, Ltd., and Industrial Distributors, Ltd.

BUENOS AIRES, March 8--Angel Borlenghi, Minister of the Interior, told La Prensa employes again today that their being unable to go to work was purely a labor question and had nothing to do with a lack of guarantees by the Government.

HALLANDALE, Fla., March 8 (AP) Double M Farm's Lambent, one of the most consistent horses of the winter season, survived a blanket finish to win the featured Homestead purse of $3,000 at Gulfstream Park today. He was first by a head under a husky ride by Ovie Scurlock.

HALLANDALE, Fla., March 8 (AP) Double M Farm's Lambent, one of the most consistent horses of the winter season, survived a blanket finish to win the featured Homestead purse of $3,000 at Gulfstream Park today. He was first by a head under a husky ride by Ovie Scurlock.

PANAMA, March 8 A general civil strike against the present Government was demanded tonight in a manifesto read at a meeting in Sant Ana Plaza. The manifesto was signed by six former Presidents and eighteen former Cabinet Ministers, together with more than twenty members of the National Assembly and former members of the Constitutional Congress.

WASHINGTON, March 8 The Truman Administration's decision to station American ground troops in Europe for the common defense of the West was endorsed, 23 to 0, today by the combined Senate Foreign Relations and Armed Services committees.
The Federal Maritime Board will start "breaking out" forty reserve fleet freighters immediately under a financial agreement signed with the Economic Cooperation Administration.

The discovery not so long ago that a third, two-lane tube would soon be needed for the Lincoln Tunnel across the Hudson at Thirty-eighth Street, Manhattan, must have startled even the experts who watch traffic statistics. The rapid rise in use of the Holland Tunnel, the Lincoln Tunnel and the George Washington Bridge since the war sounded the warning that planning...

Maximilian Moss, president of the Board of Education, called last night upon the city's schools to respect for other nations to promote world peace. He spoke at the opening of an exhibit on "Israel: Rebirth of a People and its Arts," at Midwood High School, Bedford Avenue and Glenwood Road, Brooklyn.
THOSE who have been complaining because they failed to take in a field trial during the past season will have two opportunities during the next few weeks, and both should prove well worth the trip.

FRANKFORT, Germany, March 8 The Federal Republic of West Germany is very close to acceptance of the Schuman plan after a week of intensive effort on the part of the United States and the German Government.

The New York Knickerbockers gained one of their greatest victories of the National Basketball Association campaign last night at Madison Square Garden, though guilty of one of their poorest performances. The Knicks were often seventeen points behind the Minneapolis Lakers and yet Joe Lapchick's lads triumphed, 97 94, in overtime before 6,751 fans.

PARIS, March 8 The solution of the French electoral conflict proposed by Premier-designate Henri Queuille of the Radical party will go before the National Assembly tomorrow. The proposal, so to speak, offers a prize to each contestant party.

For the first time in 1951, consumers will find not a single price increase on fresh produce this week-end. In fact, with supplies steadily increasing, there are declines of 2 to 6 cents on a dozen items. This is the third week in which fresh vegetable and fruit prices are lower.

MOSCOW,. March 8 Pravda today charged the United States with deliberately seeking to confuse the deliberations in Paris of the deputies of the Big Four foreign ministers to prevent adoption of an agenda that would provide concrete and specific discussion, of the question of German remilitarization.

A new group of thirty-six handblown glass pieces made by the Tiffin Glassmakers of the United States Glass Company was presented at the Pierre Hotel yesterday. The bowls, compotes, epergnes, candlesticks and vases, which form the major part of the collection, will be available in this city in time for use with spring table settings.
The number and variety of art exhibitions in New York continues unabated.
SAN FRANCISCO, March 8 (AP)--The American Newspaper Guild, C. I. O., gave its 1950 Heywood Broun Award today to Leonard Jackson, a reporter for The Bay City (Mich.) Times.

Frank Costello, gambler and reputed silent power in Tammany Hall, admitted at the Senate Crime Inivestigating Committee's recent closed hearings that he had recommended candidates for elective office.

Heavy evening-up in the March position continued yesterday in active trading in cotton futures on the New York Cotton Exchange. Prices at the close were unchanged for March and May at the ceiling of 45.39 cents, but new-crop months were off 9 to 86 points. There was heavy profit-taking in new-crop months during the day.
A sharp rise in cargo rates coupled with an increased demand for petroleum products has reduced tree availability of tankers. They are reported scarce and obtainable only at high price.

BERLIN, March 9 (Reuters)--The Most Rev. Peter Legge, the only Roman Catholic Bishop residing in the Soviet Zone of Germany, died today at his home in Bautzen, East Germany. His age was 68. He became Bishop for the Province of Saxony, in the Bishopric of Meissen, in September, 1932.
TOKYO, Saturday, March 10 (AP) Communique 818 by General of the Army MacArthur's headquarters, for the period 6 A.M., March 9, to 6 A.M., March 10:

Civilian alertness and fast police work resulted in the arrest yesterday of four men in a stolen automobile fifteen minutes after two of them had allegedly held up John D. Revelle in his liquor store at 921 East 172d Street, the Bronx.

Salvatore T. Sollazzo, indicted as a basketball "fixer," remained in City Prison yesterday after he pleaded not guilty in General Sessions to a thirteen-count true bill alleging bribery of college players. He had been held without bail since his arrest Feb. 18.

Leiser Weitman, 31-year-old Austrian, was sentenced to twentytwo months in a Federal Penitentiary and fined $2,000 by Judge Mortimer W. Byers in Brooklyn Federal Court yesterday. Weitman had pleaded guilty on March 1 to two counts of a three-count indictment charging him with smuggling 1,862 carats of high-quality diamonds.

LONDON, March 9 Responsibility for the conduct of Britain's foreign affairs was transferred tonight from the bowed and shrunken shoulders of Ernest Bevin to the younger ones of Herbert Morrison, another man of humble origin who rose to eminence with the Labor party that he helped to build.

ALBANY, March 9 Strong pressure for in limiting of New York City's authority to increase its sales tax from 2 to 3 per cent to one year, that is, if it is granted at all, developed today among Republican legislators.
WESTPORT, Conn., March 9 A few score of Connecticut's commuting husbands made their trains this morning with plenty of time to spare.

HONG KONG, March 9 An officially sponsored refugee organization in Peiping has sent a telegram to British Prime Minister Attlee demanding that a seventeen-member mission from Communist China be permitted to enter Malaya to investigate "conditions of the suffering overseas Chinese."

CHICAGO, March 9 Net profit of Illinois Bell Telephone Company last year increased to $25,231,329, equal to $9.24 a common share, from $13,162,955 or $5.63 a share in 1949, William V. Kahler, president, said today in his first annual report. He was elected to the position on Jan.1 when G.K. McCorkle was elevated to chairman.

HALLANDALE, Fla., March 9 (AP)--William H. Veeneman's Black George, essentially a sprinter, had the class necessary to beat eleven others at a mile-and-a-sixteenth in the Malada Purse at Gulfstream Park today.
The City had denied use of any of its piers to the Polish-flag motorliner Batory, the vessel on which Communist Gerhart Eisler escaped from this country in May, 1949.

WASHINGTON, March 9--Clarence J. McCormick, Under Secretary of Agriculture, was informed today by several members of the House Agriculture Committee that no bill to authorize Federal funds for the transportation of farm labor, such as was voted during the last war, would pass the house.

BUENOS AIRES, March 9 The Government-backed General Confederation of Labor announced today that it had decided to retain its complete boycott against La Prensa until the paper yielded without reservation to all the demands made upon it by the news venders' union.

ALBANY, March 9 Assemblyman John R. Brook, Republican of Manhattan, today introduced, through the Assembly Rules Committee, a bill to permit non-resident payers of income tax to claim deductions about the same as are allowed to residents.

Counsel for Otis Co. challenged in Federal Court here yesterday earlier testimony in the Kaiser-Frazer damage suit against the investment concern to the effect that Cyrus S. Eaton once remarked that he would rather face a law suit than "go broke" handling a 1948 offering of the automotive company's stock.

The Korean landscape is the most devastated and its refugees are the most destitute in the history of modern warfare. This is how J. Donald Kingsley, United Nations agent general for Korean reconstruction, summed it up on his return last week from a trip to the Far East.
GUATEMALA, March 9 Antonio Goubaud Carrera, 48-year-old Guatemalan Ambassador in Washington since December, 1949, committed suicide last evening at his home.

Members of the National Association for Nursery Education, holding their biennial conference at the Commodore Hotel, yesterday adopted resolutions calling for Federal funds for expansion of group day care services for children, ...
WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP) Tobacco men from four states today condemned the Treasury's proposal to raise cigarette taxes almost 50 per cent.

BUENOS AIRES, March. 9 President and Senora Peron closed the first Pan-American Games under brilliant floodlights in the River Plate Stadium tonight. The occasion was more ceremonial than competitive but in the final event, Chile won the Cup of the Nations for equestrian jumping and a Chilean captain gained top individual honors.

WASHINGTON, March 9 A Federal grand jury will open here next Monday an investigation into possible perjury by witnesses in the Senate's inquiry into alleged political influence and favoritism in loans of the Reconstruction Finance Corporation.
Seventy-five years ago today on March 10, 1876 the first Intelligible telephone sentence was carried over forty feet of wire in the top floor of a boarding house in Boston.

BONN, Germany, March 9--The Federal Government, the Socialist opposition and all parties of the West German Parliament save those of the extreme left and right today united to demand that the four occupation powers create conditions for Germany's reunification at any meeting of the Council of Foreign Ministers.
The debut recital of Virginia Passacantando last night in Town Hall revealed a young pianist of more than average finger skill, much spirit and a general air of assuredness.

David Greenglass, a former Army sergeant who worked on atom bomb projects at Oak Ridge and at Los Alamos from 1944 until early 1946, involved his sister, Ethel, and her husband, Julius Rosenberg, in Federal Court yesterday as plotters who obtained bomb secrets from him for Soviet Russia.
ATLANTIC CITY, March 9 (AP) Five men, believed lost aboard the fishing boat Kristine M during a storm on Nov. 25, were declared legally dead today.
BERLIN, March 9 "It begins to look as though prospects are brightening for the masses of unemployed," Brig. Gen. Lemuel Mathewson, United states Commandant in West Berlin, said today.
Last July 9, about 7 P.M., Samuel Sansevere, who is 24 years old, was looking over cargo receipts aboard a lighter at Pier 9 in Hoboken, N.J.
When the surface of the smoldering volcano is eggshell thin, as it is in Iran, a shot fired in a mosque may start an eruption that can spread in many directions.

Office of Price Stabilization discussions on wool pricing with members of the wool industry advisory committee have come to an end, it was learned yesterday. The decision on pricing, long awaited by the trade, is expected in about two weeks and rests with the O. P. S.
In recent weeks we have heard many reasons why teachers' salaries should be increased. We have supported those who seek to raise the pay that our teachers get.
PARIS, March 9 Henri Queuille, a leader of the Radical party, was endorsed today by the National Assembly as Premier. A new coalition was won by a vote of 359 to 205.
WASHINGTON, March 9 (AP) Harbor radar systems can save large sums by avoiding ship delays in periods of low visibility, Rear Admiral Roy W. M. Graham, U.S.N. (ret.), said today.

ST. LOUIS, March 9 Claude I. Bakewell, Republican and a former Representative, was elected to Congress from Missouri's Eleventh (St. Louis) District today in a special election. Harry Schendel, his Democratic opponent, conceded defeat at 9:15 P.M.
Discrimination issues were ruled irrelevant yesterday by Municipal Court Justice George L. Genung in eviction proceedings against thirty-one tenants of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village.

JERSEY CITY, March 9 After one of the briefest and most peaceful budget hearings in this city's history, the 1951 budget, calling for an estimated tax rate of $73.16 on each $1,000 of assessed property valuation, was adopted by the City Commission.

WASHINGTON, March 9 The Senate Crime Investigating Committee heard testimony today that two Illinois liquor wholesalers, in a conspiracy with buyers, were bootlegging thousands of cases of whisky into "dry" areas of the South.

The paintings documenting the conditions of health among American Indians on United States reservations and in Indian and Eskimo villages in Alaska, which were recently at the Sherry-Netherland Hotel for a three-day preview, begin today a two-week stay at the American Museum of Natural History.

Two adjoining apartment houses on plot 100 by 200 feet at the northeast corner of West Broadway and Longacre Avenue, Woodmere, L.I., have been sold by the Herflo Realty Corporation to the Wilenn Realty Corporation for investment. Slomka Bros.
A two-year program for furnishing Japanese cherry trees to United States cities as a gesture of friendship between the two nations has been agreed upon and the first shipment will soon leave Tokyo.

PARIS, March 9 The European Marshall Plan Council will discuss tomorrow a proposal by a committee of experts that a step toward a single market be taken by removing all import quotas on textiles in intra-European trade.

KARACHI, Pakistan, March 9 The Government announced today that a plan to seize the Governor General and members of the Cabinet and establish a military dictatorship in Pakistan had been foiled by the arrest of the chief of the army general

ALBANY, March 9 A bipartisan bill to accomplish an interparty deal involving the creation of two additional County Court judgeships in Queens was submitted to the Legislature today, reportedly with the consent of Mayor Impellitteri.

ALBANY, March 9 The Rules Committees of the Senate and Assembly introduced today legislation directing the Attorney General to make a study of all aspects of the narcotics problem and to make recommendations to the Legislature next year. An appropriation of $50,000 is authorized for the investigation.

The Defense Housing and Community Facilities and Services Act of 1951, now pending in Congress, is largely "infiationary and unnecessary" in many of its provisions, the American Bankers Association charged yesterday.
Bond men are busy trying to figure out how nearly the yield of the new non-marketable 2 per cent bond can be translated into terms of current yields on marketable investments.

So many non-sequiturs and red herrings are tossed by the Soviet delegate into the discussions that the meeting of the deputies in Paris begins to look like an effort not to find an agenda for a Foreign Ministers conference.
CHICAGO, March 9 Trading in grain futures was light on the Board of trade today with all interests inclined to go slow pending further developments in the European political situation.
Frank Erickson, the convicted bookmaker, and officials of the Roosevelt Raceway at Mineola, L.I., will be the first witnesses before the Senate Crime Investigating Committee here on Monday.

SAN FRANCISCO, March 9 The belief that this country is in "a very sound position" aeronautically and that our planes are better in every category than those of any potential enemy was voiced today by Edward H. Heinemann, chief engineer of the Douglas Aircraft Company, El Segundo Division, in a talk to the Bay Area chapter of the Aviation Writers Association.

A Wall Street "Sherwood Forest," in which a defendant banking house in the Government's antitrust trial took profits from big firms and distributed other profits to smaller concerns was described in Federal Court here yesterday.

SANTIAGO, Chile, March 9 Eugene Black, president of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, offered the services of the bank today to the Chilean Government in the preparing of detailed studies of the principal phases of Chile's economy and how to develop it further.

ANDOVER, Mass., March 9 The marriage of Miss Joan Waugh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Clarence Samuel Waugh of Andover, to Munson Campbell, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Lyman Campbell of 1170 Fifth Avenue, New York, took place this afternoon in Christ Protestant Episcopal Church here. The Rev. John S. Moses performed the ceremony. A reception was held at the November Club.

WASHINGTON, March 9 (UP) Representative John S. Wood, Democrat of Georgia, chairman of the House Un-American Activities Committee, disclosed today that the committee had subpoenaed twenty-six witnesses to testify in its new hearings on communism in Hollywood.

A thug who was "armed" with a harmless toy gun was shot and killed by two policemen shortly after 10 o'clock last night after a $92 hold-up in a liquor store at 1243 Third Avenue, between East Seventy-first and East Seventysecond Streets.
NATCHITOCHES, La., March 9 (AP) The ancient college hazing prank about the "irate husband" ended in tragedy today when Allen Kaplan, 18-year-old freshman, Was found dead in a Red River whirlpool.
The tenth annual conference of the Laymen's Movement for a Christian World will be held on Friday and Saturday at the Statler Hotel.

Plans for broad expansion of the Druggists Supply Corporation, a marketing and, buying organization that has specialized in sundries for drug outlets, have been announced by W. Rutherford James, chairman of the board.
